1565292603_1H79P7Dn1eqyVFFhsPux4ZyApMuhz.body: Turn off Zeronet, find your zeronet.conf and change the data_dir variable. On Arch Linux, the path is /etc/zeronet.conf. You should copy old your folder to the new location.

8_1J3rJ8ecnwH2EPYa6MrgZttBNc61ACFiCj.body:
> [nicehat](#comment_9_1LPjWhB47YZwaWoSQH1d2tnj2E3JnMU2cw): How do I change where the data is being stored in linux?

Find your zeronet.conf (try /opt/zeronet if you use ArchLinux) and add "data_dir = path" in it.

Alternatively, you can launch zeronet with the argument  "--data_dir path". Try python2 zeronet.py --help.

> [nyanasi](#comment_3_1GCX671SdfGDqwXhgjySi8RRALoB4vwHCD): Favoriting a site in ZeroHello removes it from my 'files' list. Bug? Intended behavior?

I also have this bug. If I unfavorite a Zite, it shows up again in the "files" list.
